reviews.review_msg: I don't recommend taking a class with him. He is very disorganized and just reads definitions off the slides. Does not explain the material very well.

terrible, avoid at all costs. lazy and unapproachable. waste of time and money. he did not know material, read definitions off slides that were already from textbook. cannot teach what so ever. ta's taught us 10x more than he did. take it with someone else
He was a terrible instructor, lectures were uninformative and pointless and he was not very well organized

Worst prof ever! He never seems to know what he's doing. Lectures were a waste of time. Always end lecture in an hour when we paid for 2 every week. The TAs were way more knowledgeable than him. Avoid him at all cost.
Decent Prof, no complaints. I would take the class with him again. lectures weren't boring.
Jessie is an awful prof. He was never there for his office hours and when he was to be found his answer would be to tell me to go to the T.A's office hours on a different day.
Jessie was an awful prof. Lectures were useless and he was very slow at providing course materials. Take 207 with someone else.
Explained majority of course material in lectures. As with any course independent learning and textbook use is required. knowledgeable with a proficient grasp on the material he was teaching.
Amazing professor, taught lectures and material with enthusiasm. Readily available for help during office hours. Would recommend to anyone.

I found him to be a very poor instructor. He was extremely disorganized and explained the material very poorly (if at all). His lectures were not informative or helpful at all and his class was a frustrating experience. I would not recommend you take his class.

hardest prof ever, hardly engaging when actually on topic. hardly ever on topic. tells us stories instead of explaining questions or answers. Might as well be distance education, you have to do everything yourself. good luck if you take this prof.

Emrul is an outstanding professor who makes learning difficult content so much easier through carefully explaining and applying the concepts described. There really is nobody better to take BUS 207 with.

Highly recommend Dr. Hasan. Come to lectures, as they are engaging and he gives real-world insights for everything. Dr. Hasan wants you to pass and he wants you to succeed. If he is teaching a class, take it.

Professor Emrul is an outstanding instructor for 207. His lectures were engaging, connecting real-world concepts to bring managerial economics to life. The course is challenging and requires a lot of effort to get a good mark, but Professor Emrul's teaching style makes the material much more approachable and fun.

Amazing lecturer. 3 hour lectures passed by like nothing, very engaging and funny but also very passionate about what he teaches. Provides real world examples which help relate to the course content. Favourite professor I've had so far in my undergrad. Emrul is a gem.

Professor Hasan brings the course material to life with engaging real-world examples. Though the workload is demanding, his teaching style and commitment to student success make BUS207 an enriching experience. unstuckstudy ai was a helpful study tool alongside the course resources.

I don't normally give a 5/5 ratings but Emrul definitely deserves it. He makes class fun and explains the concepts very well. The course itself is hard but he made the lectures entertaining so the 3 hour classes didn't feel that long. However you need to put in the work for a good mark. I totally recommend taking 207 with him!

I didn't like the guy at the start. He skipped two weeks of our schedule due to absences, but as the weeks went on, his philosophy of respect, and justice where due reflected. All exams and projects were fair, and lectures were engaging despite the difficulty of its content. I kind of owe him one because he made economics fun again.  Thanks Emrul.

Prof. Hasan genuinely cares about the success of his students. He knows the material very well so he doesn't usually teach from slides but rather takes a more organic approach to teaching. He is very good at simplifying tough concepts by drawing his own graphs and diagrams. Easily one of my favorite profs at SFU. A very nice person in general.

Heads up, there are 80 question MyLabs for each chapter, prof is a lil disorganized, and crazy group assignments. All in all though, prof was funny. I failed bus 207 before with Karen Ruckman and this man pulled me through the mud. Thanks Emrul, missing you everyday

The course is hard but it was one of the relevant courses I was able to apply to my life. His real-life examples, stories, and teachings made the class very fun and engaging. At times he's a bit unorganized but it wasn't a big deal as you just have to review the assignments, mylab and textbook to succeed in the course.
He was a good prof. Funny. Engaging. Man knows it all.
He is caring and always try to be in his student's shoes. His teaching is fun as he brings real life examples to showcase the concepts. He is very friendly. Thanks to him I got my first A+ at SFU.
nice guy, but could have been a better teacher and try to be more prompt with attendance

Out of the other bus 207 prof, the prof was the best for me because of his grading structure. His grading isnt 100% exam based, and if it was, I would of failed. I failed my midterm & was below average by ALOT but came thru in the final. It was because he has assignments part of our grade to save it & made final worth more if you did better on it

This professor is the best I have had so far! He is just too good. His explanations, examples and practicality is outstanding. This is one of the most useful courses you will take in your program but only if you are doing it with Emrul.

I highly highly recommend him!

What an absolute South Asian Gem! He made the final easy (concept-based) and similar to the group assignments so his students could do well. He gives a lot of homework but he is flexible with the deadlines if you ask for an extension beforehand. 

Loved his jokes, especially about cricket and the baby milk formulae (iykyk). Would recommend 10/10
I honestly thought I was going to get a C+ for this course since I was below the average for the group assignment and midterm, but hurray! Curve saved my grade. Best prof ever!!!
had a great time in his class and his exams/assignments were fair, directly taken from the textbook/mylabs

Great guy, and tells great stories. Gives real world examples to relate to material. Assignments were fair and gave us enough time to complete them. Funny guy, lectures were always interesting. Liked how he would do in class examples, then dive into the material. Truly understands his students, definitely recommend.
finished our final today but nice guy
never once have I wanted to fall asleep in his lectures

Fine, he shows up late to class, mylabs on short notice and goes on rants. Lectures and homework consistent with midterm. Tells you what's going to be on the exam. Has charisma and a sense of humor. Generous with marking. This guy is as smart and qualified as SFU profs will get and gives real-world advice. Take him if you're not scared to work hard

Will miss prof Emrul Hasan! His lectures are engaging and always uses real life applications for his topics. His midterm exam was very similar to the mylab and group assignments while average is low. I got my first midterm with over 90% with this prof. Go through all the homework and mylab and you'll be set for the midterm. Lovely guy and cheers!

I do not know where such high ratings come from, but this prof does not know how to teach. what we cover in the classes was not in the homework, and h/w was given on short notice so you will have to block two days just to get it done. one of the most disorganized profs that  barely replies to emails.

Haven't even finished the course yet but the first month has been terrible. His lectures you don't really learn anything in, as he makes you do in-class assignments are useless you don't learn from them, starts class 10 mins late then speeds through lectures without giving a clear point on what to focus on, he doesn't even follow his own syllabus.
One of the goated profs in econ & beedie. Just beware that he'll unexpectedly assign 80 questions on short to no notice. :)

In my opinion, this class started out not bad. We had 2 group assignments which we were well aware of. However, the MyLab questions were given on short notice 60-70 per MyLab homework (crammed mostly in second half of the course). The worst part, the take home assignment. Even though it was 6 essay questions, you need to use full 6 hours no break.

Umm, how do I even express my distaste for this class? His test structure is good but god the homework. 7 HW assignments, over 70 multi-part questions each, including excel given on short notice. Very stressful. No time. Bad class. Said no final but gave a take-home assignment so is a liar :(. Oh and he likes to clap at people in class so behave.

Emrul is a very nice instructor who seemed to care for his students, and showed passion for teaching. He was very proficient when using real life examples to integrate with economic perspectives learned in this course. This course is not an easy course as there is a lot of theory, graphs, and calculations. He mostly tests from lecutres not textbook
I just loved the way Emrul teaches 207. He is inspirational and entertaining. 3 hours go really fast while you also learn a lot. Liked the way he connected personal experience with econ theories.

I enjoyed having Emrul as a prof. He seems to genuinely care about his students. However, he did seem a bit unorganized at times, and he could maybe improve by making his own lecture slides for the course. Overall though, he was crystal clear on what to expect on exams, gave good examples in class, and kept the 3 hour lecture entertaining.

Emrul is really funny and honestly don't know any way to teach 207 any better. He goes through only exam related topics during his lectures so you don't waste any time there. He DOESN'T use a textbook and he doesn't have answers on his slides, so you have to attend lecture to know how to do the aspects that he's testing on.
Honestly, one of the most approachable profs at SFU. Funny, and teaches the core concepts really well. 207 is generally a hard course, but with Emrul, you're golden.

overall great prof im glad I had emrul.. ahh the first midterm was kinda mean.. but even though he didn't need to he created an alternative grading scheme which kept me motivated.  "Could you zoom in a bit more?" "Could you move closer a bit more?" ded.

Emrul truly cares about students and it shows during his lectures, he makes an effort to try and describe things in ways we understand. This semester he had like 1000 students and at times he seemed a bit rushed. 1st midterm seemed kind of unrelated to lecture content, but the 2nd midterm and final were crystal clear in terms of criteria.

Emrul had amazing lectures and was very clear about what was important to know for the exams. Nothing tricky and everything was very clear. He explained everything very well and did not rush concepts. He was teaching many courses but made sure that he was very accessible to all of his students. Amazing prof overall!

Honestly, Emrul was one of the best professors I've ever had. His lectures are very engaging due to his constant use of his personal life examples to explain course concepts. His positive attitude always kept the class spirits up and made us enjoy coming to lectures. BUS 207 is kind of a hard course on its own but with Emrul it's way better.

Emrul is very effective in his teaching. Not many professors are able to stimulate the students to the extent Emrul does, so he provides a great environment to learn. As a teacher, Emrul has great communication skills in that explanations are short, helpful, and entertaining. God bless him.

Emrul is the best prof I've even met at SFU. I'm not sure what other people are saying here but I love his class and I'm going to take more courses with him. He never rushes the class and gives good examples that helps me to understand better. I don't even have to read the book if I take notes. Well recommended.
You could tell Emrul genuinely cares about making the material interesting, enjoyable and comprehensible to everyone. Great attitude about teaching. Seems he loves his job.
